channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 2024 年是对民主神经的巨大考验
item.description: 2024 is a giant test of nerves for democracy econ.st/3OJLbRq

item.title: 新技术正在净化工业流程
item.description: New technologies are cleaning up industrial processes econ.st/3SI0smV

item.title: 在美国寻求正义并非朝九晚五的工作
item.description: The search for justice in America is not a nine-to-five job econ.st/3T0AKvp

item.title:
"这些艺术品是如此诱人和令人沮丧 因为里面的东西似乎是如此难以接近"
@amayor 在本周的 "巴贝奇 "播客中讨论了人工智能如何破译古代卷轴👇。
item.description:
“These are artefacts that have been so tempting and frustrating because what’s in them seems so inaccessible.”

@amayor discusses how AI can decipher ancient scrolls, on this week’s “Babbage” podcast econ.st/3weOz06 👇

item.title: "即使这些政党失败了，他们似乎也有不成比例的影响力"。在我们的 "制衡 "播客中，@JohnPrideaux 解释了国家保守主义的力量🎧。
item.description: “Even when these parties fail, they seem to have disproportionate influence.” On our “Checks and Balance” podcast, @JohnPrideaux explains the power of national conservatism econ.st/3T0yZy2 🎧

item.title:
让客户、员工和投资者满意并非易事。
这就是好市多深受喜爱的原因： 👇
item.description:
Keeping customers, employees and investors happy is no mean feat.

This is why Costco is so loved: econ.st/3UHS6OU 👇

item.title: 英国有一小部分人遭受了不成比例的犯罪。警方应重点关注他们 👇
item.description: A small number of people in Britain suffer a disproportionate amount of crime. The police should focus on them econ.st/3UJn0X5 👇

item.title: 大英帝国已经过时，但出版有关大英帝国的书籍却很流行。萨特南-桑盖拉（Sathnam Sanghera）的《帝国世界》👇加入了新书出版的浪潮。
item.description: The British Empire is out of fashion, but publishing books about it is in vogue. Joining a wave of new titles is “Empireworld” by Sathnam Sanghera econ.st/42G9MMA 👇

item.title:
日军利用约 20 万亚洲平民和 6 万盟军战俘的奴隶劳动来修建缅甸铁路。
我们回顾了杰克-詹宁斯的一生，1942 年 2 月，他发现自己也属于这一类人👇。
item.description:
The Japanese army used the slave labour of around 200,000 Asian civilians and 60,000 Allied prisoners-of-war to build the Burma Railway.

We look back at the life of Jack Jennings, who found himself in that category in February 1942 econ.st/3uAciri 👇

item.title: "瘟疫的智慧》将抗击瘟疫的斗争置于历史背景中，指出从狩猎采集到农耕的转变如何使虫子更容易从牲畜身上跳到人身上👇。
item.description: “The Wisdom of Plagues” puts the struggle against pestilence in historical context, noting how the shift from hunter­-gathering to farming made it easier for bugs to jump from livestock to people econ.st/49hV68S 👇

item.title: 旗舰项目如何成为英国问题的寓言？读读这个拖延已久的高铁项目，它将成为世界上最昂贵的项目 👇
item.description: How did a flagship project become a parable of Britain’s problems? Read the much-delayed high-speed rail project that will become of the most expensive in the world econ.st/3UJtXaO 👇

item.title: 英国最辉煌的时刻早已逝去；现在，那些在其中战斗的人也即将离去。英国必须面对的不仅是一代人的逝去，还有一个小众文学流派的逝去。
item.description: Britain’s ﬁnest hour has long since passed; now those who fought in it are passing, too. Britain must face the loss not only of a generation but also, somewhat less seriously, of a niche literary genre econ.st/3UKbj2u 👇

item.title: 人工智能的蓬勃发展为旧金山带来了 "巨大的机遇"，@arynbraun 告诉我们的 "Money Talks "播客，旧金山可以充分利用其技术专长。"问题是......这是否真的会发生。
item.description: The AI boom presents “a massive opportunity” for San Francisco to capitalise on its tech expertise, @arynbraun tells our “Money Talks” podcast. “The question is…whether or not that actually happens” econ.st/3SJs4Il 🎧

item.title: 传说米开朗基罗于 1530 年在佛罗伦萨的一间密室中躲藏了几个月。一些学者认为这难以置信。但这间密室现已向公众开放，是一项具有里程碑意义的发现👇。
item.description: Legend has it that Michelangelo holed up in a secret room in Florence for a few months in 1530. Some scholars find that hard to believe. But the room—now open to the public—is a landmark finding nonetheless econ.st/3UEjVHT 👇

item.title: 对于它的反对者来说，它是一种可憎的东西--"科学怪人肉"。而对它的拥护者来说，实验室培育的肉类有望拯救地球。在欧洲，关于培养肉的争议十分激烈：
item.description: For its detractors, it is an abomination—“Franken-meat”. For its advocates, lab-grown meat promises to help save the planet. In Europe, the controversy over cultured meat is searing: econ.st/3SZkMBI

item.title: "我认为普京觉得他需要重新确立让他掌权的恐惧"在 "情报 "节目中@ArkadyOstrovsky 反思了阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的谋杀案。收听播客： 👇
item.description: “I think Putin feels he needs to reassert the fear that keeps him in power.” On “The Intelligence” @ArkadyOstrovsky reflects on Alexei Navalny’s murder. Listen to the podcast: econ.st/4bFicrR 👇

item.title: 如何看待帕勒的回归 ⬇️
item.description: What to make of Parler’s return econ.st/3wdaYeg ⬇️

item.title:
投资大宗商品变得异常困难。
投资者必须应对政治和技术方面的一系列不确定性--重要的不仅是西方的政策和需求👇。
item.description:
Investing in commodities has become nightmarishly difficult.

Investors have to contend with a barrage of political and technological uncertainties—and it is not only Western policies and demand that matter econ.st/49cVYf4 👇

item.title: 战争和冲突进一步削弱了2023年的全球民主。在我们的姊妹公司 @TheEIU 对 167 个国家进行的排名中，平均得分为 5.23 分（满分 10 分），是该指数开始以来的最低分👇。
item.description: War and conflict further undermined global democracy in 2023. The average score of 5.23 out of ten in a ranking of 167 countries by @TheEIU, our sister company, is the lowest since the index began econ.st/49vk1Wc 👇

item.title: 今天的 "情报 "节目：纳瓦尔尼之后的俄罗斯反对派、英国对电动汽车的需求放缓、《肖申克的救赎》在中国上映。收听每日播客： 🎧
item.description: Today on “The Intelligence”: opposition in Russia after Navalny, Britain’s slowing demand for electric cars, and “The Shawshank Redemption” hits the stage in China. Listen to the daily podcast: econ.st/49mFUaI 🎧

item.title: 想为《经济学人》撰写关于中国的文章？我们正在招聘一名驻华记者 👇
item.description: Want to write about China for The Economist? We are hiring a correspondent to focus on the country econ.st/3SCnqf2 👇

item.title:
为失职的金融工具辩护。
尽管通胀保值债券并不总能抵御通胀，但它确实有更广泛的用途 👇
item.description:
In defence of a financial instrument that fails to do its job.

Although they do not always protect against inflation, inflation-protected bonds do serve a wider purpose econ.st/3T2sIkz 👇

item.title: 未来的追求者们正在向派拉蒙招手。该剧凸显了娱乐业的悲惨现状👇。
item.description: Would-be suitors are wooing Paramount. The drama highlights the sorry state of the entertainment industry econ.st/3SYienc 👇

item.title:
经济脱碳需要大量的金属，但矿业公司却不愿放松银根。
了解他们不愿投资的原因，以及如何才能让他们投资： 👇
item.description:
Vast amounts of metal are required to decarbonise the economy, but mining firms are reluctant to loosen their purse-strings.

Find out why they are reluctant to invest—and what it will take to get them to dig in: econ.st/3I3wmW1 👇

item.title: 胡塞武装的宗教领袖阿卜杜勒-马利克-胡塞（Abdel-Malik al-Houthi）发誓要继续袭击船只，直到以色列停止轰炸加沙并允许不受限制的援助进入。也门组织欣喜于来自国外的鼓励，但很少有人注意到它在国内对人性的蔑视
item.description: The Houthis’ religious leader, Abdel­-Malik al-Houthi, vows to continue attacks on ships until Israel stops bombing Gaza and lets in unfettered aid. The Yemeni group rejoices in encouragement from abroad, but few notice its disdain for humanity at home econ.st/3wrNO3P

item.title:
种族隔离后的南非常常因其自由公正的选举而备受赞誉。
但是，由于非洲人国民大会的统治地位，这些选举的结果一直都是预料之中的。直到现在 👇
item.description:
Post­-apartheid South Africa is often lauded for its free and fair elections.

But such is the dominance of the African National Congress that the results of those elections have always been foregone concusions. Until now econ.st/49xHIgA 👇

item.title:
问题不仅在于美国是否会放弃乌克兰，还在于美国是否会放弃欧洲。
请阅读唐纳德-特朗普可能重新上台的阴影如何笼罩着欧盟国家： 👇
item.description:
The question is not just whether America will abandon Ukraine, but whether it might abandon Europe.

Read how the spectre of Donald Trump’s possible return to office is looming over EU states: econ.st/3wiwEWl 👇

item.title:
匈牙利是全球重塑右翼政治运动的中心。
维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）所信奉的民族保守主义与罗纳德-里根（Ronald Reagan）和玛格丽特-撒切尔（Margaret Thatcher）时代的民族保守主义截然不同。
item.description:
Hungary is at the heart of a global movement to reinvent right-wing politics.

National conservatism, espoused by Viktor Orban, marks a radical departure from the sort that prevailed in the era of Ronald Reagan and Margaret Thatcher econ.st/48mPLvI 👇

item.title: 公开来源的调查人员说，越来越多的证据表明，一小队乌克兰特种部队正在苏丹作战。我们将解释他们可能在那里做什么 👇。
item.description: Accumulating evidence suggests that a small team of Ukrainian special forces is fighting in Sudan, open-source investigators say. We explain what they might be doing there econ.st/3OLqLYk 👇

item.title: 低价产品和营销手段正在吸引点击。亚马逊该如何担心Shein和Temu？ 👇
item.description: Dirt-cheap products and marketing splurges are catching clicks. How worried should Amazon be about Shein and Temu? econ.st/4bCXqcl 👇
